Description: 8 beads of different shapes and materials. A: half preserved spherical bead made of blue to turquoise frit. Parts of perforation visible. B: cylindrial bead made of light green faience. C: cylindrical bead of a slightly larger size, only partly preserved, made of a light green faience. D: cylindrical segmented bead made of a green to turquoise faience. E: flattened sphere bead made of a red stone. F: extended sphere bead made of a light green faience. G: cylindrical bead made of copper alloy, inside the perforation a whitish-cream coloured paste. Both ends are not cut off staright but askew. H: ring bead made of a pinkish-orange material, faience? On the surface a salt layer.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
